About This Game

The local multi-player space narwhal fighting game that has rocked the internet is finally ready for its big debut in a fully loaded release!

Flop it out with 1-4 players in a retro, epic narwhal battle in space! The heart-piercing action is furious and unrelenting. STARWHAL will change your life.

Inspired by countless couch-gaming gatherings over the decades, we wanted to bring something competitive, creative, and immediately fun to the table. Our original prototype was conceived and developed in 48 hours with focus entirely on these areas. From that came the phenomenon that is STARWHAL.

STARWHAL is a simulation of dreams in an ocean of the mind.

Features:

  • 4 player local multiplayer mayhem - 90+ costumes, 25 arenas, and 4 game modes to duke it out with friends or AI players.
  • 32 single player Obstacle and Target challenges with leaderboards, ghost replays, and achievements.
  • Successfully made it through Steam Early Access, shaping the game around the feedback from fans around the world.
  • New radical graphic effects!
  • You can be a space narwhal wrapped in a burrito.

What people are saying:

"Starwhal is one of the best multiplayer games of the year, chaotic and intensely competitive"
-IGN

"If Jacques Cousteau were here, he'd sh*t all over the floor."
- Wiley Wiggins on STARWHAL

"Get a friend. Play this NOW. I'm laughing so hard"
- Sean "Day[9]" Plott

"This game is awesome"
- Achievement Hunter

"This large hairless intergalactic aquatic mammal simulator will bring out the 'Ooo!', "Aaa!' and 'So CLOSE!' in everyone"
- Ross Kenry O'Donovan (Distinguished Conductor of the Steam Train)

"Starwhal brings bloodthirsty neon space whales into an entirely new dimension, capturing the spirit of local co-op deathmatches like only a neon space whale can. We couldn't recommend it more."
- Polaris

Dank Shanker
44 products in account
14 reviews
Recommended
3.9 hrs on record
Posted: June 20
If you love narwhals, then you really should try this out. It's a challenging game with different game modes. Clash with other narhwhal CPU's, friends at your house, or just try to do an obstacle course on your own. One of the gamemodes you try to get as many points as you can by hitting a heart on another narwhals chest. Customize your narwhal with the style you love. The controls are simple, but that doesn't make the game easy. Here comes the hard part-moving. When flying around, the narwhals aren't very stable. This game is very unique. I have never seen any game like this.

Ryan Dorkoski
619 products in account
292 reviews
Not Recommended
0.5 hrs on record
Posted: June 10
I played this game with three players, local. Yes, this game is mildly fun and gets alot of laughs. Is it worth the money, considering there are far better couch co-op/versus games out there? Not so much.

The problem with this is that while there are plenty of levels and game modes, there is not much depth . Single player experiences are meh, at best. For the meantime I will stick with TowerFall and Duck Game . Here is a breakdown of what I think:

Pros:
+Interesting in-your-face psycodelic art style
+Music is pretty decent
+Wonky controls and gameplay certainly gets alot of laughs
+"Just the tip" LOL

Cons:
-Not enough depth - for example, TowerFall has loads of unlockable levels and characters, and some force you to experience single player to get at
-Strategy and gameplay are far too simple compared to competitor titles - its basically just move and taunt
-Too expensive for what it is
-I think multiplayer is local only


Overall, I would only pick this up if you have all the better couch co-op/versus titles.

The_Toast3r
286 products in account
20 reviews
Recommended
3.8 hrs on record
Posted: September 16
Why recommended:

Nice little game with lots of cute Narwahls.
This is a great couch game, as controls and mechanics are easy and you can sometimes win with luck alone, so lesser skilled friends can still enjoy it :)

So if you're looking for a colorful local only (!) multiplayer game for literally breaking your friends hearts, definetly give it a try.

+ Colorful Graphics
+ Easy to learn controls
+ Still a luck component, so lesser skilled players still stand a chance -> MP friendly!
+ Hearts everywhere!

0 Sound is so-so. Quite nice, but way too repetitive. Goes great with my own electronic music library though :)
0 Can't tell about keyboard support, only played it with controller. But guess keyboard might suck as when comparing analog stick to controller DPad.
0 Single player challenge maps somewhat nice with different obsacles and later ones pretty hard. But at least for me still not that entertaining. You might feel differnt, though.

- AI. It's fine for classic mode with basic maps and for a basic training. But they don't really work with some of the game modes and maps containing lava and such.


Don't buy if:
* You neither have friends to play this with locally (only!)...
* ... nor like repeating levels to beat your highscores and collecting medals/achievements-
* You do not like Narwahls.
